results.title: The Persistent gum
results.brief_description: Short film on eucalypt strategies for coping with environmental stress, mainly fire. Useful introduction to this topic, which is an imnportant factor in forest ecology. Some terms may need to be explained prior to showing. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Forests of pine
results.brief_description: The steps in pine plantation management and a rationale for their use. Details of the various types of forests in Tasmania, their climatic conditions and locations. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Hollywood: the Selznick years
results.brief_description: Shows the typical Hollywood of the 1930’s and 1940’s through the work of David O. Selznick. Includes footage from several films, commentary by some of the stars, tapes and rare footage of screen tests for “Rebecca” and “Gone with the wind” and the only existing film of Laurette Taylor and Maude Adams (actresses). A useful springboard for discussion. Aspects of the film which would make it useful include the Jewish producer role in the US at a time when Nazism was strong in Europe. Overall commentary by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Wheel is turning in Nepal
results.brief_description: Traditional culture and beginnings of technological change in Nepal. Shows the lifestyle and threatened crafts of Nepal including an introduction to Nepalese/Tibetan/Indian cooking, flour milling, and rice winnowing, wood turning, and pottery, the use of natural resources such as water to power the wood turning lathes and indicates the effects of tourism and increased trade on the native craftsmen.

results.title: Worry: I'm in big trouble now
results.creator_credit: Donald Connors, Guidance Association and Motion Media
results.brief_description: Designed to help young people understand and deal with their feelings and emotions. Presents the story of a boy whose neglect of this responsibilities leads to the disappearance of his younger brother. The viewer is left to decide what the boy will do and what he should do.

results.title: Murray River salination
results.brief_description: This film begins by showing the building of the Dartmouth Dam on the Mitta Mitta River to flush out the Murray River whose river basin is comparable to the Danube Basin, but has only 17% of the Danube’s flow. It shows the devastating impact of ever-increasing salinity in the Murray River on the agricultural productivity and the purity of Adelaide’s domestic water supply. Suggests ways of overcoming the salinity problem through saline interception schemes, such as those pioneered by the NSW government. A valuable insight to the political nature of the great Muray River by its custodians, Victoria, South Australia and New South Wales. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Adelaide waters
results.brief_description: Discussion of the problem of using the waters of the Murray River as the major source of Adelaide’s domestic water supply. Looks at the political history of the Dartmouth Dam, and the probability of severe water shortages in the case of prolonged drought. An excellent discussion starter for studies relating to water management.

results.title: Sea eagles
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A recruiting film for the Royal Australian Navy, showing life in Australia’s Fleet Air Arm. We see how living on an aircraft carrier is exciting and full of non-stop action. We also see how Australia’s Navy aviators fly helicopters for rescue and recovery, as well as attack, and the striking force of the fixed wing Skyhawk jets and the two-engined Tracker aircraft as they come and go from the deck of their seabound base.

results.title: Echidna
results.brief_description: This unique animal’s story is told in this film. Its place in the Australian fauna is established when it is shown how it is related to the platypus and the marsupials. Points out how the echidna differs from other members of the porcupine family and how this species respresents a link with past ages. Indicates why this species has survived and includes sequences on its appearance, food, distribution and habitat. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Revenge of a kinematograph cameraman
results.creator_credit: Ladislas Starevich and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Provides an example of an early animated puppet film by Ladislas Starevich, a young Polish artist, who gained international recognition for his pioneering work in animated and trick films. Starevich worked at one time for the Khanzhonkov, a Russian studio, but later emigrated to Paris. His work had a light, satirical touch, which in those days, was almost unique among Russian film-makers. Also known as ‘The Cameraman’s Revenge’ Mrs Beetle is involved with a grasshopper artist while Mr Beetle is seeing a dragonfly cabaret performer! An intricate drama of (f)lies, deceit and the just revenge of the cinematographer. One of Starewicz earlier films, possibly the very first cinematic treatment of insect fidelity.
